programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: Keith finds a historic house that was half renovated, and is now available at a price they could flip into one of their biggest profits ever—over 200 grand. But this old house reveals tons of problems, from an outdated electrical system, to crooked floors, to a second story with low, sloping ceilings that only a kid could love.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: This Zombie house is a literal stinker from years of cigarette smoke that has stained the walls and left a putrid smell throughout the property. But as the flippers make over this monster, things start smelling sweeter when they uncover clues to a hidden treasure. As costs of this tricky reno pile up, they hold out hope of striking it rich by unearthing a huge payday.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping

The Zombie team takes on the challenge, but with interest rates set to go up, it's a race to finish before housing prices take a tumble.

programme.title: Wildlife Nation with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff embarks on a mission to help bring bison back to the North American continent. He travels to the Canadian border to help Native American tribes re-establish new bison herds across tribal lands. Jeff learns how ancient bison herds once shaped the Great Plains and how modern conservationists are fighting to bring those herds back. Later, Jeff travels to the Kodiak Island Archipelago where the native Allutiq people are managing a new population of American bison.

programme.desc: An eccentric scientist builds a time machine, which accidentally transports a high-school student back to the 1950s, where the teen inadvertently interferes with the budding romance between his future parents. The boy must figure out how to set things right, or risk completely altering the future.

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II
programme.desc: A teen time-travels from 1985 to 2015 in order to save his parents and his children from the disasters precipitated by his own mistake when he traveled to 1955 and bought a book in order to enrich himself in the future.

programme.title: Back to the Future Part III
programme.desc: A teen must leap the space-time continuum to 1885 in the DeLorean time machine in order to rescue its inventor, whose 70-year-old letter reveals that he has retired to the Old West to live out his days there. Upon arriving, the boy finds the scientist in love and in danger.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia.

programme.title: Armed Forces Bowl
programme.desc: Baylor (6-6) vs. Air Force (9-3) in the 20th Armed Forces Bowl. From Amon G. Carter Stadium in Fort Worth, Texas. Troy Calhoun's Falcons beat Army and Navy and bid for bowl wins in consecutive years for the first time since 2009-10. Baylor has four wins in its last five bowls, under four different coaches, including current coach Dave Aranda's Sugar Bowl title last year. The Bears were 0-5 vs. ranked foes.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: After travelling around the country for years, Guy Fieri's '68 Camaro needs some help. While his buddies at VP Speed Shop work on her identical twin sister, Guy stops by for check-ins and brings some of his favorite dishes from amazing local joints.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.sub-title: Triple D Nation: From Sausage to Sweet
programme.desc: Guy Fieri's got sweet and savory when he tries knock-out candy apples at a treat truck in Pembroke, NC, and visits a tried-and-true butcher shop in Brigantine, NJ. Then, an old school Jersey City diner has a new name, but the pancakes are still the same.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, And Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri's hitting the road and digging into some down-home cooking. In Garland, Utah, a century-old staple serves up savory sandwiches and a sweet treat. In Oklahoma City, a local landmark first opened in the 1950s dishing out Southern specials.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri's hitting up joints owned by Food Network super chefs, like Maneet Chauhan, who is serving up her creative spin on Indian recipes in Nashville. Then, in Cleveland, Guy joins Michael Symon, firing up pork belly at his barbecue spot.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Meats that are grilled, smoked and fried are in the spotlight. Included: a Miami charcuterie known for its wild boar sausage and house-cured bacon. Also: a funky joint in Modesto, Cal., featuring monster tacos and a sweet and savory waffle; and an ex-NFL player who's slinging wings that score with sauce.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, And Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri's digging into all kinds of different meats on this trip. In Ottawa, Canada, a carnivore haven stacking sandwiches with dynamite duck and a pork trifecta. In Richmond, Virginia, a taco joint loading up out-of-bounds oxtail.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, And Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri tries restaurants with inventive dishes.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri's grabbing all kinds of funky flavor, starting in Laramie, WY, where a restaurant-bar is pilin' up their nachos, and a longtime spot is cooking up a vegetarian banh mi. Then, a Mexican joint in Alaska is serving dynamite duck tacos.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri dives into mega meat and a little bit of sweet. In Atlanta, a Korean-taqueria mashing up unique flavors in their chicken tacos and bulgogi fries. Then in Austin, a pizza joint putting out killer pastrami and scratch-made caramel roll.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy Fieri is takes a culinary trip filled with adventurous flavor. In Los Angeles, he visits a funky spot all about filling bowls with eclectic eats. programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Pub food is on the menu. Included: a Minneapolis brewery known for its pulled pork and brisket sandwich; a Miami joint serving Southern favorites like hen and dumplings and a lamb belly BLT; and an Italian restaurant and bar dishing out mega-meat pizza and wild boar gnocchi.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy orders a short-rib burger and savory apple strudel at a throwback bar in Denver; in Tempe, Ariz., he visits a Pakistani restaurant and tries a goat recipe, as well as tandoori chicken; and finally, in Philadelphia, chicken pie and grilled octopus are eaten.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.desc: Argentina vs. France in the final. From Lusail Iconic Stadium in Lusail, Qatar. Golden Boot contenders Lionel Messi and Kylian Mbappe (five goals each in Qatar) star in the 11th clash of South America and Europe in a final. Didier Deschamps and "Les Bleus" can become the first back-to-back champs since Brazil 60 years ago, while the Argentines look to end a 36-year title drought since the days of Diego Maradona. Julian Alvarez and Olivier Giroud (four goals each) head the supporting casts.

programme.desc: Alabama (1-0) at Texas (1-0). From DKR-Texas Memorial Stadium. Second-year Texas coach Steve Sarkisian faces the squad he assistant coached in his previous stint (2019-20), with RB Bijan Robinson powering the 'Horns vs. LB Will Anderson Jr. and 'Bama. The Tide won the last meeting for the 2009 BCS Championship.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Michigan (11-0) at Ohio State (11-0). From Ohio Stadium. It's the first time since 2006 that these bitter rivals meet while both undefeated, with a Big Ten title shot on the line. The Wolverines won 42-27 last year to snap an eight-game series slide.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Southern California (9-1) at UCLA (8-2). From the Rose Bowl. QB Caleb Williams and top target Jordan Addison lead USC's bid to avenge last year's 62-33 loss to the Bruins, SC's worst setback in this rivalry since 1954. RB Zach Charbonnet powers UCLA.

programme.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup Qatar
programme.desc: Argentina vs. France in the final. From Lusail Iconic Stadium in Lusail, Qatar. Golden Boot contenders Lionel Messi and Kylian Mbappe (five goals each in Qatar) star in the 11th clash of South America and Europe in a final. Didier Deschamps and "Les Bleus" can become the first back-to-back champs since Brazil 60 years ago, while the Argentines look to end a 36-year title drought since the days of Diego Maradona. Julian Alvarez and Olivier Giroud (four goals each) head the supporting casts.

programme.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup Qatar
programme.desc: Germany vs. Japan in a Group E opener. From Khalifa International Stadium in Al Rayyan, Qatar. Goalkeeper Manuel Neuer opens his fourth World Cup for Germany, now coached by Hansi Flick. MF Daichi Kamada heads a heavy German club presence for Japan, with seven players toiling in the top two Bundesliga divisions.

programme.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup Qatar
programme.desc: Morocco vs. Portugal in a quarterfinal match. From Al Thumama Stadium in Doha, Qatar. Tournament Cinderella Morocco eyes Africa's first-ever semifinal berth after a defense keyed by PSG's Achraf Hakimi allowed just an own goal in four games. Portugal showed its strength beyond Cristiano Ronaldo in a 6-1 rout of the Swiss to open the knockout round.

programme.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup Qatar
programme.desc: England vs. France in a quarterfinal match. From Al Bayt Stadium in Al Khor, Qatar. Gareth Southgate's England squad have scored a tournament-high 12 goals, while French dynamo Kylian Mbappe's five goals led the Golden Boot race entering this round. On all-time goals lists, Harry Kane is one shy of catching England leader Wayne Rooney, while Olivier Giroud became France's all-time leader while knocking out Poland.

programme.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup Qatar
programme.desc: England vs. U.S. in a Group B match. From Al Bayt Stadium in Al Khor, Qatar. England opened with a 6-2 rout of Iran, while the USA drew 1-1 with Wales. This is the third World Cup meeting for these foes after a 1-0 U.S. win (1950) and a 1-1 draw (2010).

programme.title: Jesus: His Life
programme.desc: The Roman Empire occupies the land of Judea in a time of turbulent unrest, as a simple craftsman named Joseph faces a personal test of faith in the small town of Nazareth, when his fianc e Mary tells him she is expecting a child, who is the Son of God. Joseph vows to love and protect his son Jesus through many dangers: his birth in Bethlehem, the visit of the Magi, and the flight to Egypt to escape death at the hands of mad King Herod.

programme.title: Jesus: His Life
programme.desc: Some thirty years after Jesus is born, his life intersects with that of John the Baptist, a radical preaching in the desert against Judea's rulers, including Herod's son, Herod Antipas. John baptizes Jesus, starting his divine mission, but loses his own life, beheaded in a famous conflict with Herod Antipas's step-daughter, Salome.

programme.title: Jesus: His Life
programme.desc: Mary, the mother of Jesus, is torn between wanting to protect her son and letting him go to fulfill his sacrificial destiny when the time is right; until Jesus is 30, only she and Joseph know his mysterious mission. Jesus performs his first public miracle at her request at the Wedding Feast of Cana.

programme.title: Jesus: His Life
programme.desc: Caiaphas faces an impossible dilemma as High Priest of Jerusalem and religious leader of the Jewish people. Caught between determination to preserve his faith and the repressive might of Rome, Caiaphas must judge how great a provocation Jesus of Nazareth might pose. Jesus' astonishing raising of Lazarus from the dead marks a turning point. Afraid that Jesus could prompt an uprising and possible brutal retaliation from Rome's prefect, Pontius Pilate, Caiaphas decides Jesus must be stopped.

programme.title: Jesus: His Life
programme.desc: The story of Judas is explored.

programme.title: Jesus: His Life
programme.desc: Pontius Pilate, the Roman governor of Judea, has to make a decision about a troublesome preacher called Jesus. Instead, Pilate sends him away to be crucified, and publicly washes his hands of responsibility.

programme.title: Jesus: His Life

programme.desc: Humble family man Bill Baker contends with the unthinkable when his daughter calls him from a French prison, revealing that she has been charged with murder. Determined to prove his daughter's innocence to the French courts and secure her freedom he embarks on an odyssey from rural Oklahoma to France driven by paternal instinct.

programme.desc: Charles Stone III, who directed the "Whassup!" Budweiser commercials, is the driving force behind this powerful fact-based drama set in 1986. Wood Harris is superb as a straight-arrow Harlem delivery man who gets involved selling drugs and becomes the premier distributor of cocaine in his neighborhood. Mekhi Phifer, Kevin Carroll, Cam'ron.

programme.title: George & Tammy
programme.desc: Tammy questions whether George can handle the pressures of superstardom.

Last Vegas
programme.desc: Four geriatric friends head to Las Vegas for a bachelor party that recaptures the magic of their glory days in this outrageous all-star comedy.

programme.title: Bad Influence
programme.desc: A strait-laced, insecure L.A. yuppie becomes corrupted by an immoral young drifter who introduces him to the seedier side of life.

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: Six Oscars, including Best Picture and Actor (Tom Hanks), went to this extraordinary tale of a simple man who unwittingly becomes involved in some of the key moments of the 20th century. Meanwhile, as the remarkable parade of his life goes by, Forrest never forgets Jenny, the girl he loved as a boy, who makes her own journey through the turbulence of the 1960s and '70s that is far more troubled than the path Forrest happens upon.

programme.title: The Social Network
programme.desc: In this sweeping tale of Internet success, nerdy, awkward Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the Web site Facebook and becomes a billionaire, but ends up embroiled in legal disputes as the friends who helped him during his rise to the top are now eager to see him fall.

programme.title: Montana Story
programme.desc: The story of estranged siblings Erin and Cal, who return home to their Montana ranch to take care of their comatose father. Both harbor resentment for their abusive dad, with Cal feeling guilt for being unable to protect his sister. Erin, on the other hand, hasn't been back since the blowout that caused her to run away from home. Now, the man whose influence shaped their lives has inadvertently given the two a chance at reconciliation.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: Robert Harling adapted and expanded his stage hit, a character study set in small-town Louisiana that celebrates friendship among a group of strong-willed women who discuss their lives—especially the shortcomings of their men—at Truvy's beauty salon. Julia Roberts earned her first Oscar nomination as Best Supporting Actress for her portrayal of stubborn Shelby. Harling costars as the minister.

programme.title: As Good as It Gets
programme.desc: James L. Brooks' acclaimed romantic comedy about a plucky New York waitress (Helen Hunt) and a phobic, curmudgeonly novelist (Jack Nicholson). Greg Kinnear costars as his gay neighbor in this story of love, forgiveness and acceptance. The three leads were Oscar-nominated. Cuba Gooding Jr., Skeet Ulrich, Shirley Knight.

programme.title: G.I. Jane
programme.desc: A woman trains to become the first female Navy SEAL while being sold out by a Texas senator who's being blackmailed by the Defense Department. Meanwhile, the aspiring SEAL suffers intense mental and physical anguish in the struggle to prove herself.

programme.title: Confess, Fletch
programme.desc: Confess, Fletch is a reboot of the classic crime-comedy film. This time, Fletch becomes the main suspect in a series of murders while investigating thieves that stole his girlfriend's art collection. To exonerate himself, Fletch begins his own investigation into the murders and discovers a lot of people could be the guilty party, including his art collecting girlfriend.

programme.title: Old Henry
programme.desc: When widowed farmer Henry and his son Wyatt discover a riderless horse with blood on the saddle, they realize that fallen rider Curry has a satchel stuffed with cash and some dangerous men hot on his heels. But when the men arrive, Henry must defend himself using gun skills that shock those around him, raising questions about his past.

programme.title: Dead For A Dollar
programme.desc: The western centers on bounty hunter Max Borlund and his fateful confrontation with lifelong nemesis Joe Cribbens. Borlund ventures into Mexico to pursue the kidnapped wife of a wealthy man. But on his journey, he reunites with Cribbens years after he sent him to jail.

programme.title: George & Tammy
programme.desc: Tammy questions whether George can handle the pressures of superstardom.

programme.title: Boogie Nights
programme.desc: Exploration of the adult-film industry in the '70s and early '80s, about the rags-to-riches career of a naive teen who's transformed into a star by a wily producer.

programme.title: The L Word: Generation Q
programme.desc: Alice and Tess discover some lies in their relationship; Shane has nowhere else to go to; Dani's romcom fantasy is ruined after she finds something that will test Sophie and Finley's trust; Micah and Maribel struggle with parenthood.

programme.title: X
programme.desc: In the 1970s, an adult film crew goes to a remote Texas farm to shoot a film. The elderly couple they are renting from is unaware of what the crew intends for their property. But they do take an unusual interest in the young team. When the couple discovers the real intention of the youngsters, a night of profit-making passion turns to terror as they fight for their lives against their enraged hosts.

programme.title: As Good as It Gets
programme.desc: James L. Brooks' acclaimed romantic comedy about a plucky New York waitress (Helen Hunt) and a phobic, curmudgeonly novelist (Jack Nicholson). Greg Kinnear costars as his gay neighbor in this story of love, forgiveness and acceptance. The three leads were Oscar-nominated. Cuba Gooding Jr., Skeet Ulrich, Shirley Knight.

programme.title: Mr. Malcolm's List
programme.desc: Jeremy Malcolm is the most sought bachelor in the English countryside. Rumors surface of a list that lays out all the perfect qualities for Mr. Malcolm's future wife. A suitor from out of town hears about Mr. Malcolm and is convinced she can win him over. Based on the novel Mr. Malcolm's List by Suzanne Allain.

programme.title: Like a Boss
programme.desc: Two best friends with contrasting personalities decide to accept a big buyout offer from a cosmetics mogul to save their company from financial ruin. Drama and hilarity ensue as intellectual property theft places a major strain on their friendship and lifelong ambitions.

programme.title: Last Holiday
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a shy American saleswoman whose doctor misdiagnoses her. When she believes that death is calling, she decides to go out with a bang and heads to Europe for an extended stay at a swanky resort.

programme.title: Something's Gotta Give
programme.desc: Jack Nicholson and Diane Keaton are dynamic in this witty romantic comedy. Nicholson plays an aging Lothario with a young girlfriend. He meets his soul mate, however, when he's introduced to his lover's mother, a playwright who can't stand the sight of him.

programme.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
programme.desc: Grappling with the onset of middle age, a Chinese immigrant discovers that she can traverse across time and space.
